DataElement.preferredName: Unstained Specimen Frozen Sections Slide Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the number of prepared slides of an unstatned frozen section, a thin slice of tissue cut from a frozen specimen without preparation methods which use dyes, reagents or other materials to produce coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to prepared slides of an unstatned frozen section, a thin slice of tissue cut from a frozen specimen without preparation methods which use dyes, reagents or other materials to produce coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A specimen that is mounted for microscopic study but without preparation methods which use dyes, reagents or other materials to produce coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.:A thin slice of tissue cut from a frozen specimen, often used for rapid microscopic diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A specimen that is mounted for microscopic study but without preparation methods which use dyes, reagents or other materials to produce coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.
A thin slice of tissue cut from a frozen specimen, often used for rapid microscopic diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Concepts.definition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the number of unstained superfrost plus slides.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
